title: Kern
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015245/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015245/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Kern**

_Noun_ -- The part of a type that overhangs the [body](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015245/http:/typophile.com/wiki/body).

_Verb_ -- To kern is to adjust the spacing between characters for visual spacing. For example an [upper case](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015245/http:/typophile.com/wiki/upper%20case) A and a [lowercase](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015245/http:/typophile.com/wiki/lowercase) v, Av can be kerned, or spaced more tightly, to be optically correct.

See also [kerning](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015245/http:/typophile.com/wiki/kerning).
author: filip blazek
